issues.description: The problem statement's class diagram and method signatures use an integer price for StockIngredient (e.g., UML shows -price: int and SealSaloon.acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int) expects an int price). The template implementation declares StockIngredient.price and its getPrice() as double (constructor: StockIngredient(String, double, int); getPrice(): double), while the solution uses int for price. This mismatch between the template and the specification/solution will confuse students and can cause compilation/type issues when they implement calculateTotalPrice (which must return int) and acceptSupplyDelivery (which supplies an int price).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template's StockIngredient price type consistent with the specification and solution by changing the price field, constructor parameter, and getPrice() return type from double to int. Concretely, in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/StockIngredient.java: declare 'private final int price;', change the constructor signature to StockIngredient(String name, int price, int quantity), and have getPrice() return int. This aligns the template with the UML and prevents type/casting problems when students implement calculateTotalPrice and acceptSupplyDelivery.
